Dear Ms. Williams:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
08/16/2021. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract
Implementation Sustainability Exit Plan (ISEP) requirements, a written corrective action
plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also violations
of the MSA and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of
this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4155 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; initial treatment plan.
(4) The social service worker shall sign and date the initial
treatment plan.
One of three initial treatment plans reviewed was not signed and
dated by the social service worker.
R 400.4155 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; initial treatment plan.
(5) The social service supervisor shall approve, countersign,
and date the initial treatment plan.
One of three initial treatment plans reviewed was not signed and
dated by the social service worker.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional ISEP requirements except for the following: Not
applicable at this time.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please note
that there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included
in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following: Not applicable at this time.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
 Zonta House will need another fire inspection by 02/28/2022.
 Zonta House will need another environmental inspection by 07/14/2022.
1

V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
 Discussed all youths attending school off grounds for 2021-2022 school year
due to school district not sending teachers to Whaley Children’s Center due to
Covid 19. Youths are required to wear masks at school.
 Discussed Whaley for Children’s staffing retention and recruitment efforts.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Zonta House did not have any corrective action plans not related to maltreatment
during this licensing period.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility
continue on their regular license.
